Orthogonalization of plane and line measurement

Source: R/faults.R
pair_correct.Rd

Both the line and the plane are rotated in opposite directions by half the angle between the slip and the plane normal vector about the vector that is perpendicular to both.

Usage

misfit_pair(x)

correct_pair(x)

Arguments

x

object of class "Pair" or "Fault"

Value

misfit_pair returns a list with the orthogonalized plane and line measurements (as 3d vectors) and the misfit angles (in radians). correct_pair returns the orthogonalized vectors.

Examples

p <- Pair(120, 60, 110, 58, correction = FALSE)
misfit_pair(p)
#> $fvec
#> Vector (Vec3) object (n = 1):
#>          x          y          z 
#>  0.4306074 -0.7432627  0.5119940 
#> 
#> $lvec
#> Vector (Vec3) object (n = 1):
#>          x          y          z 
#> -0.1752467  0.4876291  0.8552815 
#> 
#> $misfit
#> [1] 0.02793105
#> 

correct_pair(p)
#> Pair object (n = 1):
#> dip_direction           dip       azimuth        plunge 
#>     120.08575      59.20326     109.76769      58.79085
